ACTIVITIES SUPPORTED BY THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE: WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND BASIN PLANNING, SURFACE WATER MONITORING PROGRAM (SWAMP), TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD DEVELOPMENT, NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM (NPDES) PERMIT ISSUANCE PROGRAM, NPDES COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM, DATA MANAGEMENT AND QUALITY ASSURANCE.  CA SWRCB MUST MEET ANNUAL MAINTENANCE OF EFFORT (MOE) IN THE AMOUNT OF $8,907,386 (MOE/STATE CONTRIBUTION FOR THE 5-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD IS $44,536,930).  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $13,137,055. THIS AMOUNT INCLUDES $1,130,700 FROM THE ADDITIONAL SUPPLEMENTAL DISASTER RELIEF ACT AND $631,055 FOR EPA IN-KIND SERVICES FROM MONITORING FUNDS (PRC CODE 102B06XP1).  PREAWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO JULY 1, 2020.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF KANSAS THROUGH THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT (KDHE) TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. ACTIVITIES:KDHE WILL PROVIDE DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS AT 56 SITES OF CHEMICAL GROUNDWATER SAMPLES AND PHYSICAL, CHEMICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES FROM STREAMS AND LAKES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF KANSAS AND WILL DISSEMINATE RESULTS TO OTHER RESOURCE AGENCIES AND THE PUBLIC.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE; ANNUAL REPORTS AND FINAL REPORT OUTCOMES; CONDUCT SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS AT IDENTIFIED SITES IN WORKPLAN (RIVERS, LAKES AND STREAMS) IN THE STATE OF KANSAS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING OF SURFACE WATER QUALITY CONDITIONS IN KANSAS AND STRESSOR-RESPONSE RELATIONSHIPS IN STREAMS. BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF COMPARABILITY OF STATE DATA TO REGIONAL AND NATIONAL DATASETS. IMPROVED METHODS AND METRICS FOR KANSAS STREAM MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT. INCREASED EFFICIENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY OF THE KANSAS STREAM PROBABILITY MONITORING PROGRAM. IMPROVED TARGETING OF WATER POLLUTION CONTROL EFFORTS BY KDHE AND COLLABORATING AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS, AND IMPROVED HUMAN HEALTH. WIDESPREAD IMPROVEMENTS IN SURFACE WATER QUALITY CONDITIONS; OVERALL COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE CRITERIA AND ANTIDEGRADATION PROVISIONS CONTAINED IN KANSAS SURFACE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS. PROTECTION OF PUBLIC HEALTH FROM THE RISK OF EXPOSURE TO REGULATED AND EMERGING CONTAMINANTS IN DRINKING AND SOURCE WATERS BY IMPROVING THE RELIABILITY, ACCESSIBILITY, AND RESILIENCE OF THE NATION'S WATER INFRASTRUCTURE TO REDUCE THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE, STRUCTURAL DETERIORATION, AND CYBER THREATS. KDHE WILL ADDRESS SOURCES OF WATER POLLUTION AND ENSURE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS ARE PROTECTIVE OF THE HEALTH AND NEEDS OF ALL PEOPLE AND ECOSYSTEMS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF KANSAS.

ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUND WATER POLLUTION FROM POINT AND NONPOINT SOURCES.
 THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF KANSAS THROUGH THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENT (KDHE) TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THIS AGREEMENT WILL HELP KDHE PRODUCE A STATE-SCALE SURVEY OF PROBABILISTIC MONITORING THROUGH 25-35 SITES AROUND THE STATE, NEW WATER QUALITY SAMPLING AT 12-15 SITES AROUND THE STATE, A CHLOROPHYLL METHODS STUDY TO BUILD OFF OF RESULTS GATHERED IN PREVIOUS WATER QUALITY MONITORING, A GEOGRAPHIC CONTEXT ANALYSIS OF THE WATER QUALITY AROUND THE STATE, AND A USE ATTAINABILITY ASSESSMENT AT THE HEADWATERS OF STREAMS AROUND THE STATE. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE AND IMPROVING WATER QUALITY IN STATES/COMMUNITIES DOWNSTREAM. KDHE WILL CONDUCT COMPREHENSIVE SOURCE WATER MONITORING IN COLLECTING AND ASSESSING PHYSICAL, CHEMICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY SAMPLES FROM STREAMS AND LAKES THROUGHOUT KANSAS.

 THIS AWARD PROVIDES A PARTIAL AMOUNT OF FEDERAL FUNDS.  FURTHER FEDERAL FUNDING MAY BE PROVIDED AT A LATER DATE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF MINNESOTA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR THE PREVENTION OF GROUNDWATER CONTAMINATION AND THE IDENTIFICATION OF AREAS WHERE GROUNDWATER CONTAMINATION OCCURS AT LEVELS THAT PRESENT A PUBLIC HEALTH CONCERN.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING RECONNAISSANCE SAMPLING OF PRIVATE AND PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY WELLS, INTAKES OR ASSOCIATED DRINKING WATER SOURCES TO IDENTIFY AREAS WHERE GROUNDWATER CONTAMINATION OCCURS AT LEVELS THAT PRESENT A PUBLIC HEALTH CONCERN. MDH WILL SELECT SITES FOR SAMPLING TO HELP IDENTIFY THE WATER QUALITY EFFECTS OF 1) LAND USES REPRESENTATIVE OF
THOSE FOUND WITHIN SOURCE WATER PROTECTION AREAS OR, 2) LOCAL GEOCHEMICAL CONDITIONS THAT RESULT IN THE PRESENCE OF NATURALLY OCCURRING CONTAMINANTS SUCH AS ARSENIC OR RADIUM. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE A SUMMARY OF THE NUMBERS AND TYPES OF ANALYSES PERFORMED BY MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH LABORATORY, THE ASSOCIATED ANALYTICAL COSTS AND THE AREAS WHERE WELL TESTING WAS CONDUCTED.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF MINNESOTA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE COMMONWEALTH. ADDITIONALLY, THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING PROGRAM ENHANCEMENTS TO ENSURE CONSISTENCY WITH EPA AND STATE REGULATIONS IN ACCORDANCE WITH PAG-12 CAFO PERMIT REVISIONS AND WORKING WITH EPA TO ADDRESS OBSERVATIONS FROM THE PENNSYLVANIA ANIMAL AGRICULTURE PROGRAM ASSESSMENT FINAL REPORT DATED FEBRUARY 2015; MAINTAINING THE 'PHASE 3WIP WASTEWATER SUPPLEMENT' DOCUMENT AND PROVIDE THE LATEST DOCUMENT TO EPA WITH 106 PROGRESS REPORTS OR PROVIDE THE LINK TO THIS DOCUMENT ON DEP'S WEBSITE; AND IMPROVING WATER QUALITY AT WWTP OUTFALLS AND RECEIVING STREAMS THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION OF A WASTEWATER OPTIMIZATION PROGRAM.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (PADEP) TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE USE OF STATISTICAL SURVEYS, IMPROVING DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, ENHANCING BIOLOGICAL MONITORING EFFORTS, EXPANDING MONITORING NETWORKS, MONITORING NEW WATER TYPES, AND/OR OBTAINING MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND LABORATORY SERVICES IN ACCORDANCE WITH &SECTAND106 OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT.  

FUNDING IS ALSO BEING PROVIDED FOR NATIONAL STREAMS AND RIVERS ASSESSMENT ACTIVITIES.  UNDER THE ASSESSMENT, PADEP WILL BE CONDUCTING SAMPLING AT FOUR SITES: NLA22_PA-10003, NLA22_PA-10007, NLA22_PA-10010, NLA22_PA-10012.  SRBC WILL BE SAMPLING REMAINING 11 PA NLA SITES. THIS ACTIVITY PERTAINS TO ALL PROCESSES, PROCEDURES AND TRAVEL COSTS TO BE INCURRED WHEN IMPLEMENTING THE FIELD OPERATIONS MANUAL, SUCH AS SITE RECONNAISSANCE, CREW TRAINING, SAMPLING PREPARATION ACTIVITIES, FIELD METHODS, AND SHIPPING INSTRUCTIONS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO SOUTHERN UTE TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES.  THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE ENSURING THAT THE WATERS ARE SAFE FOR CULTURAL USES.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: IDENTIFICATION AND DELINEATION OF THE EXTENT OF CULTURAL USES OF WATERS IN THE ANIMAS RIVER TO UNDERSTAND HOW CONTAMINANTS MAY AFFECT TRIBAL USES AND INFORM THE NEED FOR STANDARDS REVISIONS (ETHNOGRAPHIC STUDY).  IN ADDITION, SOUTHERN UTE WILL CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS, OUTREACH, AND COLLABORATE/PARTICIPATE IN THE SAN JUAN WATERSHED MONITORING PROGRAM WORKGROUPS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO COLORADO TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES.  THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE ENSURING THAT THE WATERS ARE FOR DRINKING AND TO UNDERSTAND THE PHYSICAL AND CHEMICAL FACTORS THAT AFFECT WATER QUALITY IN THE UPPER ANIMAS RIVER BASIN.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: OPERATE AND MAINTAIN MULTI-PARAMETER WATER QUALITY SONDES TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH BY ACTIVATING AN ALERT NOTIFICATION SYSTEM IF THRESHOLDS ARE EXCEEDED AT GAGES AND PROVIDE REAL-TIME INFORMATION TO UNDERSTAND THE CHEMICAL AND PHYSICAL FACTORS THAT AFFECT WATER QUALITY.  IN ADDITION, COLORADO WILL CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS, OUTREACH, AND COLLABORATE/PARTICIPATE IN THE SAN JUAN WATERSHED MONITORING PROGRAM WORKGROUPS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO UTAH TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES.  THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE EVALUATING LAKE POWELL SEDIMENT AND WATER QUALITY IN AN EFFORT TO REDUCE NON-ATTAINMENT AREAS AND MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE.  UTAH EXPECTS TO GATHER COMPREHENSIVE EVIDENCE RELATED TO ENVIRONMENTAL PROBLEMS IN THE SAN JUAN RIVER AND LAKE POWELL IN ORDER TO EVALUATE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF STRATEGIES THAT CAN ADDRESS THESE ISSUES.  IN ADDITION, UTAH WILL CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS, OUTREACH, AND COLLABORATE/PARTICIPATE IN THE SAN JUAN WATERSHED MONITORING PROGRAM WORKGROUPS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO [INSERT STATE/TRIBE/INTERSTATE] TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. ALL DATA COLLECTION WILL BE UPLOADED TO WQX. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE MONTANA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO SOUTH DAKOTA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. - CONDUCT WATER QUALITY SAMPLING FOR THE NATIONAL RIVERS AND STREAMS ASSESSMENT

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE SOUTH DAKOTA.

THE REQUESTED EQUIPMENT (SONDES) WILL BE USED TO MONITOR WATER QUALITY WITHIN THE EXTERIOR BOUNDARIES OF THE SOUTHERN UTE RESERVATION. THE SONDS ARE USED TO ASSESS LEVELS OF DO, PH, CONDUCTIVITY AND TEMPERATURE AT 30 MINUTE INTERVALS. AND WILL BE USED TO REPLACE OLDER MODELS WHICH HAVE BECOME OBSOLETE. MORE SPECIFICALLY, ACQUIRED NEW STATE-OF-THE-ART SONDES WILL PROVIDE MORE RELIABLE DATA AND REDUCE PROBE DRIFT DURING DEPLOYMENT ASSOCIATED WITH OUTDATED ELECTRONICS OF THE OLDER SONDES THE WQP CURRENTLY USES.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS ASSISTANCE AWARD IS TO FUND THE INTERSTATE ENVIRONMENTAL COMMISSION'S (IEC) PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES, WATER QUALITY MONITORING INITIATIVE, AND WATER POLLUTION ABATEMENT ACTIVATES IN THE TRI-STATE (NY,NJ,CT) AREA. THE IEC WILL USE THE AWARDED CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 106 FUNDS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE ON ISSUES RELATED TO WATER POLLUTION ABATEMENT AND WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT; PERFORM ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSES (LABORATORY AND FIELD MONITORING) SUPPORTED BY QUALITY ASSURANCE AND QUALITY CONTROL PROGRAM TO ENSURE HIGH-QUALITY DATA; CONTINUE ITS COORDINATED COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM; CONTINUE AND EXPAND ESTABLISHED WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAMS INCLUDING COORDINATING A VOLUNTEER PATHOGEN MONITORING PROGRAM; AND PROVIDE PUBLIC INFORMATION AND EDUCATION SERVICES TO THOSE IN BOTH THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS. FOR THE MONITORING INITIATIVE, IEC WILL SUPPORT THE EXPANSION OF CONTINUOUS ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING THROUGH THE PROCUREMENT OF SUPPLIES AND EQUIPMENT AS WELL AS THE INSTALLATION OF AT LEAST ONE CONTINUOUS MONITORING STATION FOR COLLECTION OF WATER QUALITY DATA. SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS OF ACTIVITIES WILL BE SUBMITTED TO EPA. RESIDENTS OF THE TRI-STATE AREA WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IEC'S EFFORTS.ACTIVITIES:THE IEC WILL USE THE AWARDED CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 106 FUNDS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE ON ISSUES RELATED TO WATER POLLUTION ABATEMENT AND WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT; PERFORM ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSES (LABORATORY AND FIELD MONITORING) SUPPORTED BY QUALITY ASSURANCE AND QUALITY CONTROL PROGRAM TO ENSURE HIGH-QUALITY DATA; CONTINUE ITS COORDINATED COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM; CONTINUE AND EXPAND ESTABLISHED WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAMS INCLUDING COORDINATING A VOLUNTEER PATHOGEN MONITORING PROGRAM; AND PROVIDE PUBLIC INFORMATION AND EDUCATION SERVICES TO THOSE IN BOTH THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS. FOR THE MONITORING INITIATIVE, IEC WILL SUPPORT THE EXPANSION OF CONTINUOUS ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING THROUGH THE PROCUREMENT OF SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT, AND THE INSTALLATION OF AT LEAST ONE CONTINUOUS MONITORING STATION FOR COLLECTION OF WATER QUALITY DATA IN JURISDICTIONAL WATERS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:RESIDENTS OF THE TRI-STATE AREA WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IEC'S EFFORTS. SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS OF ACTIVITIES WILL BE SUBMITTED TO EPA. SOME SPECIFIC OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE: 1) SHARED INFORMATION, EXPERIENCES AND APPROACHES RELATED TO WATER QUALITY, WHICH RESULTS IN IMPROVED WATER QUALITY PROGRAMS; 2) COORDINATED WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT EFFORTS AND IDENTIFICATION OF PRIORITIES ON AN INTERSTATE BASIS; 3) PLANNING, MONITORING AND MANAGEMENT ACROSS SHARED WATERS; 4) MONITOR REGIONAL NOTIFICATIONS AND ASSIST, WHERE APPROPRIATE, IN RESPONDING TO PLANNED AND UNPLANNED SEWAGE BYPASSES; 4) PRODUCE SCIENTIFICALLY VALID INFORMATION TO SUPPORT MANAGEMENT DECISIONS RELATED TO WATER QUALITY; 5) EXPANDED REGIONAL LABORATORY ANALYTICAL AND MONITORING CAPABILITIES BASED ON REGIONALLY IDENTIFIED NEEDS; 6) ENSURE COORDINATED, INCLUSIVE AND EQUITABLE COMPLIANCE MONITORING AND ASSISTANCE RELATED TO WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND REGULATIONS ACROSS STATE BORDERS AND AMONG SHARED WATERWAYS; 7) EXPAND MONITORING DATA IN NEAR-SHORE, UNDER-MONITORED AND UNDER-REPRESENTED COMMUNITIES; 8) ENSURE EQUITABLE RECREATIONAL WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENTS; 9) PLAN MONITORING DATA THAT FILLS SPECIFIC REGIONAL GAPS IN WATER QUALITY INFORMATION; 10) PROVIDE RAPID AND 'REAL-TIME' INFORMATION RELATED TO RECREATIONAL WATER QUALITY TO INFORM STAKEHOLDERS AND USERS; 11) EDUCATE AND INFORM INDIVIDUALS AT ALL LEVELS IN THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTOR OF IEC ACTIVITIES AND RELATED WATER ISSUES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS ASSISTANCE AWARD IS TO FUND THE INTERSTATE ENVIRONMENTAL COMMISSION'S (IEC) PROGRAMMATIC ACTIVITIES, WATER QUALITY MONITORING INITIATIVE, AND WATER POLLUTION ABATEMENT ACTIVATES IN THE TRI-STATE (NY,NJ,CT) AREA. THE IEC WILL USE THE AWARDED CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 106 FUNDS TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE ON ISSUES RELATED TO WATER POLLUTION ABATEMENT AND WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT; PERFORM ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYSES (LABORATORY AND FIELD MONITORING) SUPPORTED BY QUALITY ASSURANCE AND QUALITY CONTROL PROGRAM TO ENSURE HIGH-QUALITY DATA; CONTINUE ITS COORDINATED COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM; CONTINUE AND EXPAND ESTABLISHED WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAMS INCLUDING COORDINATING A VOLUNTEER PATHOGEN MONITORING PROGRAM; AND PROVIDE PUBLIC INFORMATION AND EDUCATION SERVICES TO THOSE IN BOTH THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS. SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS OF ACTIVITIES WILL BE SUBMITTED. RESIDENTS OF THE TRI-STATE AREA WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IEC'S EFFORTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO OHIO TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE OHIO'S AMBIENT GROUND WATER QUALITY MONITORING NETWORK, INSPECTING HUNDREDS OF DISCHARGES, REVIEWING NATIONAL POLLUTION DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM PERMITS, MAINTAINING VARIOUS DATABASES WITH THE DIVISION OF DRINKING AND GROUND WATERS, AND DEVELOPING GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS CAPABILITIES. COORDINATION OF WATER QUALITY PLANNING, WATER QUALITY CRITERIA ACTIVITIES, WATER QUALITY MONITORING INITIATIVE, AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE QUALLITY OF WATER IN THE RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS AND OTHER WATER BODIES FOUND THROUGHOUT THE REGION BY MONITORING THOSE BODIES AND TAKING ACTION TO RESTORE THOSE BODIES FOUND TO BE IMPAIRED.  THE WORK PLAN INCLUDES ACTIVITITES THAT CARRY OUT A WATER POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAM WITH ENVIRONMENTAL OUTPUTS, I.E., CWA 305(B), WATER QUALITY INVENTORY REPORT, AND OUTCOMES RELATED IN RESTORING THE REGION'S IMPARIED WATERS. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO WISCONSIN TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: META-ANALYSIS OF WISCONSIN AND UPPER MIDWEST NATIONAL AQUATIC RESOURCE SURVEY DATA; EXPANDING CAPACITY FOR LAKE MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT IN NORTHERN WI; NUTRIENT LIMITATION IN WADEABLE STREAMS; DIATOM INDEX DEVELOPMENT; SUPPLEMENTAL CHEMICAL AND BIOLOGIC FIELD SAMPLING; NATIONAL RIVERS AND STREAMS ASSESSMENT (NRSA).SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD ACTIVITY ARE TO SUPPORT THE NUTRIENT LIMITATION WADEABLE STREAMS PROJECT AS WELL AS SUPPORT LAB ANALYSIS AND SAMPLING FOR NARS.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: NATIONAL AQUATIC RESOURCE SURVEY DATA TO INVESTIGATE LANDSCAPE DRIVERS OF OVERALL AQUATIC ECOSYSTEM CONDITIONS; DATA COLLECTED BY AGENCY, ACADEMIC, TRIBAL, CITIZEN, AND INDIVIDUAL RESEARCHERS SO THAT SHARED KNOWLEDGE FROM MONITORING PROGRAMS CAN BE LEVERAGED AND USED BY STAKEHOLDERS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SCIENCE-INFORMED CULTURALLY RELEVANT DECISIONS; NUTRIENT LIMITATION IN WISCONSIN'S STREAMS IN ORDER TO ASSESS THE EXTENT OF NITROGEN LIMITATION AND HELP JUSTIFY ANY FUTURE NITROGEN RELATED MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES; GOAL OF THE NRSA ARE TO DETERMINE THE EXTENT TO WHICH RIVERS AND STREAMS SUPPORT A HEALTHY BIOLOGICAL CONDITION AND THE EXTENT OF MAJOR STRESSORS THAT AFFECT THEM. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF WISCONSIN.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF MICHIGAN TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: STATE-SCALE INLAND LAKES ASSESSMENT, NORTHERN LAKES AND FORESTS ECOREGION (NLF) LAKES AND NATIONAL LAKES ASSESSMENT.

STATES WILL SELECT SITES FROM ALREADY-PLANNED RIVER/STREAM MONITORING ACTIVITIES FOR 2023 (E.G., ROTATING BIOLOGICAL SURVEY BASIN SITES).  THE USEPA EXPECTS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT IN SELECTING SITES THAT WILL COVER AN APPROPRIATE LAND USE/STRESSOR GRADIENT FOR TESTING THE EXISTING DIATOM INDICES. A USEPA CONTRACTOR WILL ANALYZE PERIPHYTON SAMPLES FOR DIATOM IDENTIFICATION AND ENUMERATION TO THE LOWEST POSSIBLE TAXONOMIC LEVEL, WHICH SHOULD BE SPECIES AND PERHAPS VARIETY LEVEL, UNDER OIL IMMERSION AT 1000X MAGNIFICATION. SIX HUNDRED DIATOM VALVES WILL BE COUNTED FROM EACH SAMPLE BY THE USEPA CONTRACTOR.  APPROXIMATELY 115 PERIPHYTON SAMPLES WILL BE COLLECTED FROM WADEABLE STREAMS AND RIVERS FROM MICHIGAN ACROSS A GENERALIZED STRESSOR/LAND USE GRADIENT. PERIPHYTON SAMPLES WILL BE SPLIT FOR DIATOM IDENTIFICATION/ENUMERATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL DNA (EDNA) ANALYSIS. ADDITIONALLY, WATER CHEMISTRY VARIABLES WILL BE COLLECTED AT EACH SITE INCLUDING AIR AND WATER TEMPERATURE, CONDUCTIVITY, PH, TOTAL PHOSPHORUS, ORTHO-PHOSPHATE, NITRATE-NITRITE, TKN, TOTAL SUSPENDED SOLIDS, AND TURBIDITY. THE EXPECTATION IS THAT SEPARATE FUNDING WILL BECOME AVAILABLE THROUGH USEPA REGION 5 TO COMPLETE THE ANALYSIS OF DIATOM DATA/INDICES AND REPORT WRITING. 

CURRENTLY MICHIGAN'S DATABASES ARE LOCATED WITHIN MICROSOFT ACCESS. ACCESS HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED BY THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET AS A PROGRAM THAT WILL NOT BE SUPPORTED IN THE FUTURE.  THIS WILL REQUIRE SWAS TO ESTABLISH NEW DATABASES TO HOUSE OUR MONITORING DATA.  UPDATING OUR CURRENT SWAS DATABASES WAS IDENTIFIED AS A GAP IN OUR 2017 MONITORING STRATEGY AND THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST IN FILLING THAT IDENTIFIED GAP.  OUR WATER CHEMISTRY MONITORING PROGRAM DATABASE HAS BEEN NAMED AS A HIGH PRIORITY DATABASE FOR UPDATES. ADDITIONAL DATABASES IDENTIFIED AS REQUIRING UPDATES FROM ACCESS INCLUDE THE STORET DATABASE, INLAND LAKE DATABASE, AND BIOSURVEY DATABASE.ACTIVITIES:PROJECT 1. REGIONAL DIATOM PROJECT 
1. ESTABLISH A CONSISTENT DATASET OF DIATOM SAMPLES FOR RIVERS AND STREAMS THROUGHOUT PARTICIPATING STATES AND REGION 5; AND 2. AS PART OF A LARGER REGION-WIDE EFFORT, EVALUATE THREE EXISTING DIATOM INDICES DEVELOPED BY INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM), USEPA, AND THE UNITED STATES GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (AND PARTNERS) FOR COMMUNITY RESPONSIVENESS TO GENERALIZED STRESSORS USING STATE- AND REGION-SPECIFIC DATASETS. 

PROJECT 2. DATABASE STORAGE 
MICHIGAN'S GOALS WOULD BE TO IDENTIFY COSTS FOR CONVERTING THESE DATABASES TO SQL SERVERS AND PRIORITIZE THE DATABASES BASED ON THE 106 MONITORING INITIATIVE FUNDS AVAILABLE TO COMPLETE THE WORK. DATABASES WILL BE DESIGNED IN A FORMAT TO EASILY UPLOAD WATER QUALITY INFORMATION INTO THE WATER QUALITY EXCHANGE. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:PROJECT 1. REGIONAL DIATOM PROJECT 
DELIVERABLES FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDE PROVIDING USEPA REGION 5 WITH A LIST OF ALL TARGETED AND COMPLETED SITES, A STATEWIDE MAP SHOWING THE LOCATIONS FOR SAMPLE COLLECTION, AND THE DELIVERY OF DIATOM SAMPLES TO THE USEPA CONTRACTOR AND USEPA ORD.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE HO-CHUNK NATION TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMMUNITY EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, SURFACE WATER QUALITY SAMPLING, INVENTORY AND ASSESSMENT OF WETLANDS, AND HABITAT ASSESSMENT AND BIOLOGICAL MONITORING, THE BENEFICIARIES ARE THE HO-CHUNK NATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE MINNESOTA POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING A STATEWIDE RANDOM SURVEY OF 120 STREAM SITES IN MINNESOTA. THE STATE SCALE SURVEY IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE CONDITION ESTIMATES FOR A POPULATION OF WATERS OF THE STATE BASED ON AN UNBIASED, REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLE ON A SUBSET OF THOSE WATERS.  THE TARGET POPULATION IS ALL PERENNIAL STREAMS AND RIVERS WITHIN THE STATE OF MINNESOTA AND ASSUMES EQUAL PROBABILITY IN STRAHLER ORDER CLASSES WITHIN EACH OF THE THREE LEVEL II ECOREGIONS. 

FISH AND MACROINVERTEBRATE COMMUNITIES, ONE-TIME WATER CHEMISTRY, AND PHYSICAL HABITAT WILL BE SAMPLED ACCORDING TO ESTABLISHED PROTOCOLS AND MPCA'S PROGRAM LEVEL QAPP WILL BE USED TO ENSURE QUALITY RESULTS. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A REPORT SUMMARIZING THE RESULTS ALONG WITH AN ANALYSIS OF TIME TRENDS WILL BE COMPLETED BY DECEMBER 30, 2027. THE NATIONAL RIVERS AND STREAMS ASSESSMENT (NRSA) SURVEY AND ASSOCIATED MPCA STATEWIDE SURVEYS USING 106 SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDS PROVIDE ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES THAT DIRECTLY SUPPORT EPA'S STRATEGIC PLAN GOAL 5 OF ENSURING CLEAN AND SAFE WATER FOR ALL COMMUNITIES, OBJECTIVE 5.2 TO 'PROTECT AND RESTORE WATERBODIES AND WATERSHEDS. THESE STUDIES WILL PROVIDE SCIENTIFICALLY DEFENSIBLE ASSESSMENTS OF THE NATION AND MINNESOTA'S RIVERINE SURFACE WATERS AND CONTINUE TO REPORT ON CHANGES AND TRENDS AT NATIONAL AND REGIONAL SCALES. DATA COLLECTED UNDER THIS PROJECT MAY BE USED TO DOCUMENT PROGRESS TOWARD THE IMPLEMENTATION OF GOAL 5.

THESE STUDIES ALSO DIRECTLY SUPPORT MPCA'S STRATEGIC PLAN AND VISION THAT 'MINNESOTA HAS CLEAN, SUSTAINABLE SURFACE AND GROUND WATER' AND SUPPORTS GOAL W.2 TO 'ASSESS THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF MINNESOTA'S LAKES, STREAM AND WETLANDS TO IDENTIFY IF DESIGNATED USES ARE BEING MET AND TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ON THE CONDITION OF WATERS.' 

THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF MINNESOTA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO ORSANCO TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO ORSANCO TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE  INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. THE FUNDING THAT IDEM IS REQUESTING, WILL RESULT IN FOUR DIFFERENT PROJECTS: PROJECT 1: DEVELOP A DATA ENTRY MOBILE APPLICATION ON TABLETS FOR ENTERING FIELD RESULTS IN THE AIMS II DATABASE. PROJECT 2: FUND A CONTRACTOR FOR THE IDENTIFICATION OF 50 MULTI-HABITAT (MHAB) SAMPLES COLLECTED IN 2022 FROM THE COOLWATER STREAM MONITORING PROJECT, PROVIDE A SYNOPTIC REFERENCE COLLECTION, AND RETURN THE IDENTIFICATIONS IN ELECTRONIC FORMAT. PROJECT 3: CONDUCT BASELINE AND PERFORMANCE MEASURE DATA COLLECTION IN THE BLUE RIVER WATERSHED. PROJECT 4: IDENTIFICATION OF MACROINVERTEBRATE SAMPLES COLLECTED IN THE BLUE RIVER WATERSHED.ACTIVITIES:PROJECT 1 ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR IN MULTIPLE PHASES: ANALYZE BUSINESS PROCESS REQUIREMENTS AND SCOPE FOR A DATA ENTRY MOBILE APPLICATION (PHASE 1); DESIGN AND BUILD FEATURES FOR MOBILE DATA ENTRY APPLICATION (PHASE 2); TEST, DEBUG AND DEPLOY THE CHANGES AND NEW FEATURES OF THE MOBILE APPLICATION (PHASE 3); AND PROVIDE END USER DOCUMENTATION AND/OR BASIC TRAINING MATERIALS (PHASE 4). PROJECT 2 ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE COLLECTION OF MACROINVERTEBRATES WHICH CONSISTS OF METHOD OF DOING A 1-MINUTE RIFFLE KICK PLUS A SWEEP OF 50 METERS OF SHORELINE WHICH ARE COMBINED AND ELUTRIATED AND THEN PICKED FOR 15 MINUTES WHILE AT THE SITE. PROJECT 3 ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE SAMPLING OF HEADWATER PORTIONS OF THE WATERSHED TO LOOK FOR WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS. PROJECT 4 BENEFITS  WILL SUPPORT THE FARMERS HELPING HELLBENDERS INITIATIVE TO ADDRESS RECOVERY OF THE ENDANGERED EASTERN HELLBENDER THROUGH IMPROVEMENT OF AQUATIC RESOURCES IN THE BLUE RIVER WATERSHED. THIS PROJECT ALSO ADDS NEW STREAM REACHES WHICH ALLOW FOR ASSESSMENT OF AQUATIC LIFE USE SUPPORT, RECREATIONAL USE SUPPORT, AND FUTURE COMPARISONS TO EVALUATE CHANGES IN WATER QUALITY.SUBRECIPIENT:THE BLUE RIVER ALSO HAS A SPECIAL ECOLOGICAL SIGNIFICANCE, AS IT IS CURRENTLY THE ONLY RIVER IN INDIANA THAT STILL SUPPORTS THE STATE ENDANGERED EASTERN HELLBENDER SALAMANDER.  IDEM AND OTHER PARTNERS HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO PAST DATA COLLECTION AND RESTORATION ACTIVITIES IN THE HEADWATERS OF THE WATERSHED. THIS WORK WOULD BE FOCUSED ON COLLECTING BASELINE DATA FOR THE LOWER PART OF THE WATERSHED, WHILE ALSO SAMPLING HEADWATER PORTIONS OF THE WATERSHED TO LOOK FOR WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AT THE END OF PROJECT 1 INCLUDE: A SUMMARY OF THE BUSINESS PROCESS REQUIREMENTS, A SCOPE OF WORK TO DEVELOP A MOBILE APPLICATION, A SUMMARY OF FINAL WORK COMPLETED TO CONSTRUCT A DATA ENTRY MOBILE APPLICATION AND A SUMMARY OF THE SERVICES ESTABLISHED TO UPLOAD DATA DIRECTLY INTO THE DATABASE CREATED. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AT THE END OF PROJECT 2 AND 4 INCLUDE AN SYNOPTIC REFERENCE COLLECTION (VOUCHER) OF ALL TAXA IDENTIFIED FROM SAMPLES. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AT THE END OF PROJECT 3 INCLUDE A REPORT TO THE U.S EPA THAT CONTAINS AN ASSESSMENT OF EACH SITE SAMPLED WILL BE REPORTED TO U.S. EPA IN THE 2026 UPDATE OF INDIANA'S INTEGRATED WATER MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT REPORT (INTEGRATED REPORT).

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE MINNESOTA POLLUTION CONTROL AGENCY TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. DESCRIPTION:PROMOTE THE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF QUALITY WATER AND RIPARIAN HABITATS AND THEIR COMPONENTS WITHIN THE MENOMINEE RESERVATION (MICRO) AND THE GREAT LAKES BASIN (MACRO) THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION OF WATERS PROGRAMS. DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A TRIBAL WATER PROGRAM TO CONTROL AND MANAGE BOTH RESERVATION GROUND/SURFACE WATER RESOURCES; IMPLEMENT AND MANAGE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS TO PROMOTE PHYSICAL, CHEMICAL AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF MENOMINEE WATERS.ACTIVITIES:ASSESS THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF MENOMINEE WATERS TO PROVIDE SCIENTIFIC INFORMATION TO THE TRIBE. DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN A TRIBAL WATER PROGRAM, COLLECT SAMPLES DURING SEASONAL EVENTS. DATA COLLECTION FROM INVESTIGATIONS OF TRIBAL CONCERNS, COLLECT DATA ON ACID PRONE LAKES. SAMPLING: STATIONS THAT WERE USED FOR THE FISH IBI ASSESSMENTS WILL BE SAMPLED FOR MACRO INVERTEBRATES. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANY DATA CREATED WILL BE ADDED TO THE WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT REPORT, AND WILL SERVE AS AN EVALUATION FOR THE TRIBE TO DETERMINE PROGRESS. DATA COLLECTED WILL ALSO BE INCLUDED IN THE FINAL REPORT AND ADDED TO WQX.  THE BENEFICIARY IS THE MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE OF WISCONSIN.

DESCRIPTION:IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (DEQ) WILL DELIVER PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY OF RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. OVERALL OUTCOME: UPDATED AND INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF ECOLOGICAL CONDITIONS OF RIVERS AND STREAMS IN STATE OF IDAHO



 SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MONITORING OF SELECTED RIVERS AND STREAMS IN IDAHO, POST-SEASON DATA COLLECTION AND SUBMISSION AND SEMI-ANNUAL AND FINAL REPORTING FOR THE PEOPLE AND FISH AND WILDLIFE IN IDAHO. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO LOUISIANA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER AND OTHER WATERBODIES. WATER QUALITY MONITORING FOR THESE PARAMETERS IS NOT PART OF THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) ROUTINE AMBIENT MONITORING PROGRAM, AND IN SOME CASES, THERE IS NO AMBIENT DATA AVAILABLE FOR THE SPECIFIC PARAMETERS. THROUGH THESE MONITORING FUNDS, LDEQ PROPOSES TO CONDUCT SPECIAL MONITORING FOR THESE SPECIFIC PARAMETERS THROUGH THE AMBIENT MONITORING PROGRAM IN ORDER TO SUPPORT WATER QUALITY STANDARDS REVIEW. THIS WILL PROVIDE DATA FOR LDEQ TO REVIEW THAT WILL AID IN DETERMINING APPROPRIATENESS OF WATER QUALITY CRITERIA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE WATER QUALITY DATA FOR ACROLEIN, ACRYLONITRILE, BIS(2-ETHYLHEXLY)PHTHALATE, SILVEX (2,4,5,-TP) AND THALLIUM THAT WILL ASSIST LDEQ IN DETERMINING THE APPROPRIATENESS OF WATER QUALITY CRITERIA FOR THESE PARAMETERS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO ALABAMA COUSHATTA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES ON TRIBAL LANDS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO FUND THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA'S SUPPLEMENTAL WATER QUALITY MONITORING INITIATIVE. THE STATE WILL CONTINUE WATER QUALITY MONITORING FOR ITS STATEWIDE STREAM/RIVER PROBABILISTIC MONITORING NETWORK. THE STATE ALSO WILL PARTICIPATE IN EPA'S NATIONAL LAKES ASSESSMENT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE OKLAHOMA OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT AND THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THE GRANT'S SUBRECIPIENT IS THE OKLAHOMA WATER RESOURCES BOARD.

THE NATIONAL RIVERS AND STREAMS ASSESSMENT IS A COLLABORATIVE SURVEY THAT PROVIDES INFORMATION ON THE ECOLOGICAL CONDITION OF THE NATION'S RIVERS AND STREAMS AND THE KEY STRESSORS THAT AFFECT THEM, BOTH ON A NATIONAL AND AN ECOREGIONAL SCALE. THE WORKPLAN ALSO INCLUDE EIGHT ADDITIONAL PROJECTS: PRECIPITATION DRIVERS OF TOTAL PHOSPHORUS (TP) OR TOTAL SUSPENDED SOLIDS (TSS); WETLAND PROBABILISTIC SURVEY; STREAM DISCHARGE REDUCTION ASSESSMENT; SHINY R WEB PILOT; NEW INNOVATIONS AND TOOLS IN LAKE MONITORING; WATER RESOURCES TRAINING PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT; APPLICATION DEVELOPMENT FOR REMOTE DATA ENTRY; HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOMS (HAB) REPORTING, VERIFICATION, AND DOCUMENTATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $164,620 TO THE KENTUCKY ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT CABINET TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SAMPLING AT APPROXIMATELY 15 WATERBODIES, CONTRACT LAB ANALYSES COSTS TO COVER TESTING FOR AROUND 27 DIFFERENT PFAS IN APPROXIMATELY 150 FISH TISSUE SAMPLES, AND A BOAT MOTOR TO ALLOW BETTER ACCESS TO SHALLOWER SAMPLING LOCATIONS FOR ELECTROFISHING. FUNDS WILL ALSO PROVIDE FOR ADDITIONAL IT DATABASE SUPPORT TO ENHANCE THE KENTUCKY ASSESSMENT DATA FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING (K-WADE), KENTUCKY ASSESSMENT AND TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD (TMDL) TRACKING SYSTEM (KATTS) AND INCREASE CAPACITY FOR ADDITIONAL MONITORING AND WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENTS.SUBRECIPIENT:FUNDS WILL ALSO PROVIDE FOR ADDITIONAL IT DATABASE SUPPORT TO ENHANCE THE KENTUCKY ASSESSMENT DATA FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING (K-WADE) AND KENTUCKY ASSESSMENT AND TMDL TRACKING SYSTEM (KATTS) BY IMPLEMENTING IMPROVED DATA ENTRY MODES TO INCLUDE BATCH UPLOAD TOOLS AND FEATURES TO SUPPORT CORRECTIONS TO HISTORICAL DATA, IMPROVE AND ENHANCE MANAGEMENT OF GEOSPATIAL DATA RELATED TO WATERBODIES, ASSESSMENT UNITS, WATERSHED DRAINAGE AREAS, AND MONITORING LOCATIONS, AND INITIATE WORK ON NEW MODULES TO MANAGE HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOM INFORMATION, WATERBODY SPECIAL DESIGNATED USES, AND WETLANDS MONITORING DATA.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE APPROXIMATELY 150 (PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES (PFAS) FISH TISSUE RESULTS FOR WATERBODIES ACROSS THE STATE, ADDITIONAL WATERSHED MONITORING AND BIOLOGICAL ASSESSMENTS, AND STAFF BETTER TRAINED IN FULFILLING MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT JOB RESPONSIBILITIES. DATABASE ENHANCEMENT OUTCOMES INCLUDE SIGNIFICANT PROGRESS TOWARD MODULES TO SUPPORT BETTER MANAGEMENT OF EXTENSIVE WETLANDS BIOLOGICAL DATA AND TRACKING AND REPORTING ON HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOM ADVISORIES, MORE EFFICIENT HANDLING OF GEOSPATIAL DATA TO STREAMLINE REPORTING PROCESSES, AND MORE EFFICIENT DATA UPLOADS AND CORRECTIONS ON HISTORICAL DATA.  DELIVERABLES INCLUDE ANNUAL AND FINAL REPORTS. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF KENTUCKY.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE IDAHO DEQ TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. PURPOSE: THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY TO PARTICIPATE IN EPA&RSQUOANDS NATIONAL LAKES ASSESSMENT (NLA). BY PARTICIPATING, ECOLOGY CONTINUES TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS LAKES. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: ECOLOGY WILL COLLECT PHYSICAL, CHEMICAL AND BIOLOGICAL DATA AT 27 SELECTED LAKES (PLUS 2 RESAMPLE VISITS) STATEWIDEAND INCLUDING LAKE VERTICAL PROFILE INFORMATION, WATER SAMPLES FOR CHEMISTRY AND BACTERIA ANALYSIS, MACROINVERTEBRATE SAMPLES AND PHYSICAL HABITAT INFORMATION. STAFF TIME WILL ALSO BE REQUIRED TO ASSIST IN COLLECTING FISH SAMPLES AT 19 OF THE SITES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES: ECOLOGY WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD ON THE DATASET ESTABLISHED FROM PREVIOUS YEARS OF THE NLA. UPDATED AND INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF ECOLOGICAL CONDITIONS OF LAKES IN WASHINGTON STATE, AND IDENTIFICATION OF SPECIFIC STRESSORS ON THE LAKE ENVIRONMENT WILL ENABLE ECOLOGY MANAGERS TO IDENTIFY AREAS WHICH MAY REQUIRE FURTHER INVESTIGATION. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: THE RESIDENCE OF WASHINGTON STATE. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE GRANTEE DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COLLECTING PHYSICAL, CHEMICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL DATA FROM 32 WETLANDS FOR ANALYSIS AND USED TO DEVELOP AN ECO-REGION CONDITION ASSESSMENTS & CORRELATIONS BETWEEN STRESSORS AND CONDITION.

THESE FUNDS FOR THE TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY ASSIST IN ACTIVITIES TO THE STATE OF TEXAS TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE NATIONAL LAKES CONDITION ASSESSMENT IS A STATISTICAL SURVEY OF LAKES OF THE U.S. THIS SURVEY IS DESIGNED TO: 1. PRODUCE A NATIONAL REPORT THAT DESCRIBES THE STATUS OF WATER QUALITY OF NATIONS LAKES, 2. EVALUATE CHANGE IN THE STATUS OF THE NATIONS LAKES SINCE THE INITIAL PHASE IN 2010, 3. HELP STATES IMPLEMENT WETLAND MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS TO GUIDE POLICY DEVELOPMENT AND PROJECT DECISION-MAKING, AND 4. ADVANCE THE SCIENCE OF LAKE MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT. SUBRECIPIENT IS A LOCAL UNIVERSITY WHICH WILL BE COLLECTING THE SAMPLES TO BE ANALYZED. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF&NBSPANDTEXAS.

ACTIVITIES INCLUDE OBTAINING DATA TO DETERMINE WHETHER 1) THE NEEDS REGARDING THE QUALITY OF THE WATER ARE BEING MET; 2) NOTE ANY CHANGES IN THE QUALITY AND/OR CONDITION OF THE NATION'S WATER; AND 3) UNDERSTAND AND DEFINE THE FUNCTION AND HEALTH OF THE STREAM ECOSYSTEM.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF LOUISIANA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. THE LOUISIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY (LDEQ) WILL EVALUATE THE OCCURRENCE OF HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOMS BY COLLECTING SAMPLES TO BE ANALYZED FOR TOXINS AND ALGAL SPECIES AND FROM SELECT AREAS. THIS INFORMATION WILL HELP TO VALIDATE CYANOBACTERIA SATELLITE IMAGERY INFORMATION FOR COASTAL LOUISIANA, WITH TOXIN DATA BEING OF PRIMARY IMPORTANCE.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF TEXAS TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SUPPORTING WORK FOR A COMPREHENSIVE SURVEY OF THE NATION'S WETLANDS. THE NATIONAL WETLANDS CONDITION ASSESSMENT IS A STATISTICAL SURVEY OF WETLANDS OF THE U.S. THIS SURVEY IS DESIGNED TO: 1. PRODUCE A NATIONAL REPORT THAT DESCRIBES THE STATUS OF WATER QUALITY OF NATION'S WETLANDS, 2. EVALUATE CHANGE IN THE STATUS OF THE NATION'S WETLANDS SINCE THE INITIAL PHASE IN 2010, 3. HELP STATES IMPLEMENT WETLAND MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS TO GUIDE POLICY DEVELOPMENT AND PROJECT DECISION-MAKING, AND 4. ADVANCE THE SCIENCE OF WETLAND MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT.

ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING AMBIENT MONITORING ACTIVIES AT BOTH SAN CREEK AND DUGOUT CREEK BY MONITORING THESE BODIES THE TRIBE WILL IDENTIFY TRENDS AND DETERMINE IF THE WATERS MEET THE IOWA TRIBE'S WATER QUALITY STANDARDS.

THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. THE PUEBLO OF ZIA WILL PERFORM ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SURFACE WATER QUALITY MONITORING, ANALYSIS OF WATER QUALITY DATA AND PUBLIC OUTREACH EVENTS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE PUEBLO OF SANDIA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES ON TRIBAL LANDS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MONITORING THE HEALTH OF THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE AND OTHER SURFACE WATERS WITHIN RESERVATION BOUNDARIES; REVIEW OF 401 CERTIFICATIONS AND NPDES PERMITS FOR COMPLIANCE WITH TRIBAL WATER QUALITY STANDARDS; COORDINATING A NEW MEXICO WATER QUALITY TRIBAL WORK GROUP TO HELP ADDRESS COMMON WATER QUALITY ISSUES; CONDUCTING NPDES PHASE I AND II STORMWATER INSPECTIONS FOR ACTIVITIES ON THE PUEBLO; AND CONDUCTING REVIEW OF THE PUEBLO OF SANDIA WATER QUALITY STANDARDS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO TO ASSESS LONG-TERM WATER QUALITY (WQ) CONDITIONS IN NEW MEXICO'S ANIMAS-SAN JUAN WATERSHED AS A RESULT OF THE GOLD KING MINE RELEASE. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE INCREASED UNDERSTANDING AND EXCHANGE OF DATA AND INFORMATION ON CONTAMINATION IN THE AREA AND ASSESSMENT OF WQ CONDITIONS OF SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER IN THE PROJECT AREA.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:  ELEMENT #3, ANALYZE EFFECTS OF CONTAMINATION ON ATTAINMENT OF LIVESTOCK WATERING AND CROP IRRIGATION USES; ELEMENT #7, REGIONAL GROUNDWATER MONITORING AND SURFACE WATER CONNECTIVITY; AND ELEMENT #12, INFORMATIONAL CONFERENCE.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA TO COLLABORATE ON THE NATIONAL RIVERS AND STREAMS ASSESSMENT, AND TO CONDUCT SUPPLEMENTAL MONITORING OF OKLAHOMA'S RIVERS AND STREAMS. THE STATE WILL CONDUCT STATISTICALLY VALID SURVEYS OF OKLAHOMA'S RIVERS AND STREAMS AS PART OF AN ANNUAL, REVOLVING EFFORT TO SAMPLE THE CONDITION OF THE NATION'S LAKES, STREAMS, OCEANS AND RIVERS. THE SUPPLEMENTAL MONITORING FUNDING WILL ENABLE OKLAHOMA TO CONDUCT STATISTICALLY VALID ASSESSMENT OF STREAMS AND RIVES AS REQUIRED BY SECTION 305(B) OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT.

THIS PROGRAM ASSISTS THE STATE OF ARKANSAS IN ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUND WATER POLLUTION FROM BOTH POINT AND NONPOINT SOURCES.  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO THE STATE FOR DATA COLLECTION FOR SELECTED LAKES AT RISK FOR HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOMS AND  FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF NUTRIENT CRITERIA FOR WADEABLE STREAMS IN THE WESTERN GULF COASTAL PLAINS ECOREGION IN ARKANSAS.

THIS AWARD ASSISTS THE NEW MEXICO ENVIRONMENT DEPARTMENT (NMED) IN ADMINISTERING THE STATE'S WATER QUALITY PROGRAM. THIS PROJECT IS TO PREVENT, REDUCE, AND ELIMINATE POLLUTION THROUGH BIOLOGICAL AND HABITAT DATA MANAGEMENT AND ANALYSIS,  UPDATING CRITICAL FLOW EQUATIONS FOR UNGAGED STREAMS, WATER QUALITY MONITORING DEVICES FOR PROGRAM ENHANCEMENT, ENHANCING NUTRIENT MONITORING AND TRAINING ON MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT AND TMDLS.

FUNDS FOR THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL HELP SUPPORT WORK FOR A COMPREHENSIVE SURVEY OF THE NATION'S RIVERS AND STREAMS.  THE NATIONAL RIVERS & STREAMS ASSESSMENT IS A STATISTICAL SURVEY OF RIVERS & STREAMS OF THE U.S.  THIS SURVEY IS DESIGNED TO: 1. PRODUCE A NATIONAL REPORT THAT DESCRIBES THE STATUS OF WATER QUALITY OF NATION'S RIVERS & STREAMS, 2. EVALUATE CHANGE IN THE STATUS OF THE NATION'S RIVERS & STREAMS SINCE THE INITIAL PHASE IN 2007, 3. HELP STATES AND TRIBES IMPLEMENT RIVERS AND STREAMS MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS TO GUIDE POLICY DEVELOPMENT AND PROJECT DECISION-MAKING, AND 4. ADVANCE THE SCIENCE OF RIVER & STREAM MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR THE STATE OF LOUISIANA TO ADDRESS GAPS OR ENHANCEMENTS IN THE STATE'S CURRENT WATER QUALITY MONITORING STRATEGY. THESE FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED SPECIFICALLY TO COLLECT DATA NEEDED TO SUPPORT THE EVALUATION OF STRESSOR-REPONSE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN NUTRIENTS AND AQUATIC LIFE IN INLAND LIKES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFIT OF THIS PROJECT WILL AID THE STATE IN PROTECTING THE DESIGNATED USES OF INLAND LAKES.

THIS PROGRAM ASSISTS ABSENTEE SHAWNEE IN ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUND WATER POLLUTION FROM BOTH POINT AND NONPOINT SOURCES. ABSENTEE SHAWNEE WILL COLLECT DATA TO ASSESS SURFACE WATER QUALITY TO DETERMINE WHETHER THE NEEDS REGARDING THE QUALITY OF THE WATER ARE BEING MET, MONITOR ANY CHANGES IN THE QUALITY AND/OR CONDITION OF THE NATION'S WATER, AND  UNDERSTAND AND DEFINE THE FUNCTION AND HEALTH OF THE STREAM ECOSYSTEM TO DEVELOP A THOROUGH WATERSHED MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATER BODIES.  THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE.    ACTIVITES INCLUDE:  INDICES OF BIOTIC INTEGRITY (IBI) FOR BIOLOGICAL COMMUNITIES IN COOLWATER STREAMS:  IDENTIFY COOLWATER STREAMS, VERIFY THE MODELS USED BY DEPLOYING TEMPERATURE LOGGERS AND COLLECTING ADDITIONAL BIOLOGICAL DATA, AND ULTIMATELY REFINE BIOLOGICAL INDICES FOR COOLWATER STREAMS. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS WILL BE TO ENSURE MINNESOTA HAS CLEAN SUSTAINABLE SURFACE AND GROUNDWATER.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $161,755 TO PARTICIPATE IN THE SUPPLEMENTAL MONITORING TO BUILD CAPACITY IN THEIR WATER MONITORING PROGRAMS BY UNDERTAKING A NUMBER OF ACTIVITIES, WHICH MAY INCLUDE THE USE OF STATISTICAL SURVEYS, IMPROVING DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, ENHANCING BIOLOGICAL MONITORING EFFORTS, EXPANDING MONITORING NETWORKS, MONITORING NEW WATER TYPES, AND/OR OBTAINING MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND CONTRACTUAL SERVICES.

THESE FUNDS SUPPORT FURTHER DEVELOPMENT AND ADMINISTRATION OF THE TRIBE'S WATER POLLUTION CONTROL AND NONPOINT SOURCE PROGRAM.  THE OBJECTIVE OF THESE PROJECTS IS TO EXPAND THE WASHOE TRIBE OF NEVADA AND CALIFORNIA'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM CAPACITY AND MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: WATER QUALITY MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT, IDENTIFYING THREATS TO GROUND WATER, NONPOINT SOURCE EDUCATION, INITIATING BIOLOGICAL AND HABITAT MONITORING, FIRE REHABILITATION, RIVER BANK RE-VEGETATION, AND PARTICIPATION AND COORDINATION IN INTERTRIBAL AND INTERAGENCY WATER QUALITY COORDINATION ACTIVITIES.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $195,000.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 07/01/2017.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF HAWAII TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. 

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $259,444.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 
1) CONDUCT STATEWIDE NEAR SHORE COASTAL CHEMISTRY MONITORING AT SELECTED SITES IN GEOGRAPHICAL AREAS THAT ARE UNDERREPRESENTED IN THE INTEGRATED REPORT. 
2) PROBABILISTIC MONITORING PROJECT TO ASSESS OFF SHORE AND NEAR SHORE COASTAL CHEMISTRY IN WATERS THAT ARE HIGH PRIORITY FOR TMDL DEVELOPMENT.
3) DEPLOY, MAINTAIN, AND COLLECT DATA FROM THREE REMOTE SENSORS IN NEAR SHORE WATERS FROM THE PACIFIC ISLANDS COASTAL OBSERVING SYSTEM (PACIOOS) TO PROVIDE CONTINUOUS WATER QUALITY DATA INCLUDING TEMPERATURE, SALINITY, TURBIDITY, PH, CHLOROPHYLL-A, AND DISSOLVED OXYGEN.
4) QUANTITATIVE MICROBIAL RISK ASSESSMENT (QMRA) ON SELECT SITES TO EVALUATE HUMAN HEALTH RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH FECAL INDICATOR BACTERIA.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: 
1) GENERATION OF COASTAL CHEMISTRY DATA FROM SELECTED SITES AND PROBABILISTIC MONITORING AND EVALUATION FOR THE INTEGRATED REPORT. 
2) GENERATION OF WATER QUALITY DATA FROM THREE PACIOOS SENSORS IN NEAR SHORE WATERS AND EVALUATION FOR THE INTEGRATED REPORT. 
3) UPLOAD ALL MONITORING DATA TO EPA DATABASE (WQX) 
4) COLLECT INDICATOR BACTERIA, HUMAN MARKER, AND PATHOGEN DATA AND USE QMRA TO EVALUATE HUMAN HEALTH RISKS AT SELECT SITES. DETERMINE IF SITE-SPECIFIC WATER QUALITY STANDARDS SHOULD BE ADOPTED FOR RECREATIONAL USE. 
5) PREPARE SEMIANNUAL AND ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REPORTS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF HAWAII TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE NEAR SHORE AND OFF SHORE SURFACE WATER CHEMISTRY MONITORING, CONTINUOUS MONITORING OF COASTAL WATER QUALITY WITH THE PACIFIC ISLANDS COASTAL OBSERVING SYSTEM (PACIOOS), QUANTITATIVE MICROBIAL RISK ASSESSMENT (QMRA) RESEARCH TO EVALUATE ALTERNATIVE FECAL INDICATORS, AND PROGRAM ENHANCEMENT PROJECTS. DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:
1) GENERATION OF COASTAL CHEMISTRY DATA FROM SELECTED SITES AND PROBABILISTIC MONITORING, SUBMISSION INTO REQUIRED DATABASE (WQX), AND EVALUATION FOR THE INTEGRATED REPORT.
2) GENERATION OF WATER QUALITY DATA FROM THREE PACIOOS SENSORS IN NEAR SHORE WATERS AND EVALUATION FOR THE INTEGRATED REPOR

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF NEVADA TO CONTINUE ENHANCING THE EXISTING STATE MONITORING PROGRAM AND TO ESTABLISH A NATIONWIDE STATISTICAL SURVEY PROGRAM IN AN EFFORT TO BEGIN ANSWERING BROADER WATER QUALITY QUESTIONS. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IMPLEMENTING THE MONITORING STRATEGY BY CONDUCTING STATE SCALE AND REFERENCE WADEABLE STREAM STATISTICAL SURVEYS, ORGANIC COMPOUND MONITORING AND DATA ANALYSIS AND WATERBODY ASSESSMENTS USING PREDICTIVE MODELS, IMPLEMENTING THE NEVADA BIOASSESSMENT PROGRAM AND MONITORING STRATEGY. THIS ACTION ALSO FUNDS NEVADA'S PARTICIPATION IN THE NATIONAL AQUATIC RESOURCE SURVEYS (NARS) FOR THE NATIONAL RIVERS AND STREAMS ASSESSMENT (NRSA). 

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $259,120. THE MAINTENANCE OF EFFORT FOR THIS AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED FOR UNDER GRANT I-97933721. SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.  ACTIVITIES:UNDER THIS GRANT, BWQP WILL CONTINUE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL AND BIOLOGICAL MONITORING AT PROBABILISTIC, TARGETED AND REFERENCE SITES; EXPAND MONITORING FOR ORGANIC COMPOUNDS; PROVIDE FOR LABORATORY ANALYSES OF WATER AND BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES; ENSURE ROBUST DATA MANAGEMENT THROUGH THE BWQP WATER QUALITY DATABASES.  THE BWQP IS CURRENTLY EXPANDING THE CAPACITY OF THE CURRENT WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT REPORTING TOOL (WART) APPLICATION TO INCLUDE BIOASSESSMENT TAXONOMIC AND PHYSICAL HABITAT DATA.   MONITORING INITIATIVE GRANT FUNDS WILL ALSO SUPPORT CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF PREDICTIVE MODELS TO ASSESS THE CONDITION OF THE STATE'S WATERS AND TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT OF BIOLOGICAL CRITERIA.  TASKS INCLUDE:
THE STATE-SCALE STATISTICAL SURVEY, REFERENCE AND TARGETED STREAMS SURVEY, MONITORING FOR ORGANIC COMPOUNDS, COMPARATIVE WATERBODY CONDITION ASSESSMENT, LABORATORY ANALYSIS; DATABASE ENTRY AND MANAGEMENT, HARMFUL ALGAL BLOOM (HAB) MONITORING PROGRAM, TRAINING AND CONFERENCES AND PARTICIPATION IN EPA'S 2023-2024 NATIONAL RIVERS AND STREAMS ASSESSMENT (NRSA).






 

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:-	PROVIDE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL HABITAT AND BIOLOGICAL DATA AND INFORMATION FOR WADEABLE STREAM AND RIVERS THROUGHOUT NEVADA. COLLABORATE AND COORDINATE EFFORTS WITH THE BWQP STANDARDS, MONITORING, TMDL AND NONPOINT SOURCE POLLUTION MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS FOR ROUTINE ASSESSMENTS, EXPANDED SURVEYS AND SPECIAL INVESTIGATIVE PROJECTS.
-	DEVELOP STREAM CONDITION INDEXES AND BIOLOGICAL WATER QUALITY INDICATORS USING PREDICTIVE MODELS SUCH AS BIOLOGICAL CONDITION GRADIENT, OBSERVED OVER EXPECTED (O/E) AND/OR MULTIMETRIC INDEX (MMI) VALUES. 
-	CONDUCT INVESTIGATIONS ON STREAMS AND RIVERS OF CONCERN, IDENTIFIED BY THE BWQP'S 303(D)/305(B) INTEGRATED REPORT AND/OR INTERESTED PARTIES, TO EVALUATE IF WQS AND BENEFICIAL USES ARE BEING MET AND TO DETERMINE IF ECOLOGICAL INTEGRITY INDICES CONFIRM OR REFUTE AREAS OF CONCERN.  
-	SUPPORT NATIONAL EFFORTS LED BY EPA TO BROADLY ASSESS THE NATION'S WATER RESOURCES.
-	ENSURE HIGH DATA QUALITY THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF APPROPRIATE QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES.
-	EFFECTIVELY MANAGE DATA AND PROVIDE TO EPA, OTHER AGENCIES AND THE PUBLIC.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE STATE OF NEVADA, THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND ALL WHO WOULD BENEFIT FROM INFORMATION ABOUT WATER QUALITY.

THE PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE SAULT STE. MARIE TRIBE (SSM) TO CONTINUE EFFORTS IN DEVELOPING THEIR CAPACITY AND INFRASTRUCTURE TO MANAGE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON THE RESERVATION.  THE TRIBE WILL 1) CONTINUE TO CONDUCT SURFACE WATER QUALITY SAMPLING; 2) PRIORITIZE THE TRIBE'S WATER RESOURCE NEEDS TO BETTER ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; 3) GROW ITS UNDERSTANDING OF CWA 303, 319, 401 AND 404 PROGRAMS TO EVENTUALLY DEVELOP THOSE PROGRAMS; 4) DRAFT A TAS APPLICATION FOR THE CWA 319 PROGRAM; 5) REVIEW THEIR QAPP; 6) CONTINUE COMMUNICATING WITH FEDERAL, TRIBAL, STATE AND LOCAL WATER RESOURCE MANAGERS; 7) BUILD CAPACITY OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM FOR WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT; 8) CONTINUE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, INCLUDING CLEAN BOATS CLEAN WATERS EVENTS AND STORM DRAIN MARKERS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO ILLINOIS TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: (1) COMPLETE AND ENHANCE THE ARCGIS STORYMAP; (2) PURCHASE A PILOTHOUSE BOAT, TRAILER, NAVIGATION ELECTRONICS AND ACCESSORIES FOR FUTURE USE IN NARS/NCCA SURVEYS (3) COLLECT AND ANALYZE APPROXIMATELY 120 PERIPHYTON SAMPLES FROM WADABLE STREAMS AND RIVERS FROM ILLINOIS; (4) PURCHASE A NEW BOAT, TRAILER, MOTOR, AND NAVIGATION ELECTRONICS AND ACCESSORIES IN ORDER TO CONTINUE ROUTINE MONITORING AND TO EXPAND THE CURRENT AMBIENT LAKE MONITORING PROGRAM; (5) FUND ILLINOIS EPA, BUREAU OF WATER, SURFACE WATER SECTION STAFF ATTENDANCE AT CONFERENCES, MEETINGS, AND WORKSHOPS; AND (6) CONDUCT CONTINUOUS DISSOLVED OXYGEN AND PH MONITORING (AS WELL AS TEMPERATURE AND SPECIFIC CONDUCTANCE) AT STREAM SITES LOCATED DOWNSTREAM OF WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT DISCHARGES FOR TWO 7-DAY PERIODS AT DOWNSTREAM OF SELECTED WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT DISCHARGES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: MAKING  ILLINOIS LAKE DATA AND ASSESSMENT INFORMATION MORE ACCESSIBLE TO THE PUBLIC BY HAVING IT SHOWN AS A LINK ON THE ILLINOIS EPA WEBSITE, AND FEATURED IN ILLINOIS EPA SOCIAL MEDIA APPLICATIONS, EXPAND THE CURRENT LAKE MICHIGAN MONITORING PROGRAM TO POTENTIALLY INCLUDE BIOLOGICAL INDICATORS, MORE INFORMATION ON HEALTH OF A WATERBODY AND TO IDENTIFY CONTRIBUTING STRESSORS SUCH AS NUTRIENTS, AND REVIEW OF CONTINUOUS DISSOLVED OXYGEN AND PH DATA COLLECTED TO DETERMINE IF THE DOWNSTREAM WATERBODIES ARE SUSCEPTIBLE TO EUTROPHICATION AND REQUIRE A SPECIAL CONDITION FOR NPDES PERMIT RENEWAL. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF ILLINOIS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO GRAND PORTAGE BAND OF LAKE SUPERIOR CHIPPEWA TO CARRY OUT ITS MISSION TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES ON TRIBAL LANDS, AND MAINTENANCE OF ITS FEDERALLY APPROVED WATER QUALITY STANDARDS PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:

1.	COLLECT SURFACE WATER SAMPLES FOR LAB ANALYSIS FROM 16 SITES, 3 TIMES PER YEAR IN MAY-OCTOBER
2.	COLLECT WATER COLUMN PROFILE DATA USING A MULTI-PROBE FROM 16 SITES, 3 TIMES PER YEAR IN MAY-OCTOBER
3.	SURVEY SHORELINE AND AQUATIC VEGETATION ANNUALLY
4.	COLLECT AQUATIC INSECTS FOR LAB IDENTIFICATION ANNUALLY
5.	ASSESS SURFACE WATER DATA COLLECTED TO MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF POLLUTION CONTROLS AND DETERMINE WHETHER WATER QUALITY STANDARDS ARE BEING ATTAINED
6.	WRITE A WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT REPORT ANNUALLY
7.	REVIEW DESIGNATED USES TO DETERMINE ARE SUFFICIENT TO PROTECT THE MOST SENSITIVE USES AND UPDATE AS APPROPRIATE
8.	REVIEW WATER QUALITY INFORMATION ON DISCHARGES TO IDENTIFY DISCHARGES WHERE HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES MAY BE ADVERSELY AFFECTING WATER QUALITY OR THE ATTAINMENT OF THE DESIGNATED USE AND UPDATE CRITERIA FOR SUCH HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES ACCORDINGLY
9.	REVIEW NEW OR REVISED FEDERAL WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND UPDATE GRAND PORTAGE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AS APPROPRIATE
10.	WRITE A TECHNICAL SUPPORT DOCUMENT IN DEFENSE OF PROPOSED CRITERIA FOR GRAND PORTAGE (TRIENNIAL REVIEW)
11.	PROVIDE PUBLIC NOTICE OF AND HOLD A PUBLIC MEETING REGARDING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS TO BE ADOPTED OR REVISED.
12.	ADDRESS ANY COMMENTS RECEIVED DURING TRIENNIAL REVIEW
13.	FOLLOWING THE GRAND PORTAGE WATER RESOURCES ORDINANCE, ADOPT REVISED WATER QUALITY STANDARDS
14.	SUBMIT ADOPTED WATER QUALITY STANDARDS FOR APPROVAL
15.	ASSESS IMPACT OF EFFLUENT(S) ON RECEIVING WATERS AND DEVELOP APPROACHES FOR POLLUTION CONTROL
16.	DEVELOP 401 CERTIFICATIONS, NEW WATER QUALITY STANDARDS, AND REQUIRE THE BEST DEGREE OF WATER TREATMENT PRACTICABLE TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN DESIGNATED USES AND EXISTING WATER QUALITY
17.	REVIEW AND PROVIDE COMMENTS FOR WATER-RELATED PROJECTS, PERMITS, LICENSES, OR PROGRAMS THAT COULD POTENTIALLY AFFECT THE RESERVATION OR HEALTH AND WELFARE OF THE TRIBE IN THE CEDED TERRITORIES
18.	ENSURE THAT ALL DISCHARGERS AND ALL PROJECTS THAT HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO IMPACT WATER QUALITY ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRAND PORTAGE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS
19.	REVIEW PROPOSED AND EXISTING PROJECT OPERATIONS WITHIN THE RESERVATION WITH OTHER CONSTITUENT AGENCIES AND OTHER LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, AS APPROPRIATE
20.	 JOINTLY DEVELOP PLANS TO ELIMINATE OR CONTROL SOURCES OF POLLUTION, TO MITIGATE ADVERSE IMPACTS OF POLLUTION, AND TO MINIMIZE RISKS TO PUBLIC HEALTH 
21.	WORK WITH INDIAN HEALTH SERVICE (IHS) TO LOCATE NEW DRINKING WATER WELLS ON THE RESERVATION AND SEAL WELLS NO LONGER IN USE
22.	ENTER DATA ON EXCEL SPREADSHEETS AND PROVIDE THE DATA TO GRAND PORTAGE GIS FOR DATABASE MANAGEMENT TO CONTINUE TO BUILD A COMPREHENSIVE WATER QUALITY DATABASE THAT CAN BE USED TO ASSESS WATER QUALITY AND ASSIST DEVELOPMENT OF PROTECTION PLANS 
23.	AFTER FIELD WORK HAS ENDED, ENTER ALL SURFACE WATER DATA COLLECTED INTO WQX
24.	CREATE ACTIVITIES TO TEACH THE GRAND PORTAGE ELEMENTARY STUDENTS ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF CLEAN WATER, WATER CONSERVATION, AND CLIMATE CHANGE
25.	ASSIST STUDENTS 12 TO 18 YEARS OLD PARTICIPATING IN THE MENTORSHIP PROGRAM TO LEARN PROPER TECHNIQUES TO MEASURE WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS ACCURATELY, PROVIDE INFORMATION ABOUT WHY WE MEASURE CERTAIN PARAMETERS AND WHAT OUR MEASUREMENTS TELL US ABOUT WATER QUALITY
26.	WRITE AN ARTICLE OR TWO FOR THE LOCAL NEWSLETTER TO INFORM GRAND PORTAGE RESIDENTS ABOUT WATER QUALITY ISSUES AND WATER PROGRAM ACCOMPLISHMENTS
27.	UPON THE REQUEST OF THE TRIBAL COUNCIL, INITIA

DESCRIPTION:THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE OHIO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY TO CARRY OUT ITS SUPPLEMENTAL MONITORING AND NATIONAL SURVEY GRANT PROGRAM UNDER SECTION 106 OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT, TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDE DATA COLLECTION OF INLAND LAKES TO ESTABLISH LAKE NUTRITIONAL CRITERIA; THE DEVELOPMENT OF MULTIPLE QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS (QAPP) TO ANALYZE THE RESULTS OF ELECTROFISHING UNITS, HOBO DATA LOGGERS' CALIBRATION, AND THE INLAND LAKES NUTRITIONAL CRITERIA. THIS PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES THE PURCHASES OF ANCILLARY EQUIPMENT AND ACCESSORIES, SUCH AS A NEW MODEL ELECTROFISHING UNIT, OXIDATION REDUCTION POTENTIAL (ORP) PROBES, HOBO DATA LOGGERS, AND HOBO WATER SENSOR UNITS TO DEVELOP AND EXECUTE ENHANCEMENTS TO THE MONITORING PROGRAM.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE THE COMPLETION OF A HOBO CALIBRATION/VALIDATION QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP), AN ELECTROFISHING UNIT COMPARISON QAPP, AND A QAPP FOR INLAND LAKES NUTRITIONAL DATA. OTHER DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE PURCHASES OF 30 OXIDATION REDUCTION POTENTIAL (ORP) PROBES, 65 LEVEL LOGGERS AND STILLING WELLS, 21 IPADS AND ANCILLARY EQUIPMENT FOR WATER QUALITY FIELD STAFF, AND 28 HOBO (OR EQUIVALENT) WATER SENSOR UNITS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE ADEQUATE COLLECTION OF WATER MONITORING DATA, PROPER ASSESSMENT OF THAT DATA, AND APPROPRIATE ASSIGNMENT OF WATER QUALITY STANDARDS FOR THE PURPOSE OF ACCURATELY REPORTING SURFACE WATER SOURCE CONDITIONS IN THE STATE OF OHIO. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF OHIO.

DESCRIPTION:
THE PESTICIDE INSPECTOR RESIDENTIAL TRAINING (PIRT) IS A NATIONAL INSPECTOR TRAINING PROGRAM TO KEEP A WELL-TRAINED STATE AND TRIBAL INSPECTION FORCE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE TRAINING ON CONDUCTING PESTICIDE INSPECTIONS, INFORMATION ON NEW REGULATIONS, INFORMATION ON NEW TECHNOLOGIES AND TOOLS TO IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICIENCY OF ALL PESTICIDE INSPECTIONS AS WELL AS TO TRAIN A CORE GROUP OF INSPECTORS THAT CAN, IN TURN, TRAIN OTHER INSPECTORS IN THEIR STATE OR TRIBE. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO FUND A PESTICIDE ENFORCEMENT AND USE CONCERNS PIRT THAT THE INDIANA STATE CHEMIST WILL HOST IN 2022.
ACTIVITIES:
THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PIRT COURSE IS TO PROVIDE BASIC AND ADVANCED TRAINING TO INSPECTORS AND INVESTIGATORS IN THE MANY CRITICAL ASPECTS OF USE/MISUSE INSPECTIONS AND INVESTIGATIONS, PRINCIPALLY DRIFT INVESTIGATIONS, AS WELL AS TO UPDATE THEM ON CURRENT INSPECTION TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGIES. THIS COURSE WILL INCLUDE PROCEDURES SUCH AS INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUES, EVIDENCE COLLECTION, DOCUMENTATION, AND INTERPRETATION, VIOLATION DETERMINATION, AND REPORT WRITING. IN ADDITION, THERE WILL BE SPECIALIZED TRAINING IN HERBICIDE INJURY IDENTIFICATION, OTHER SYMPTOMOLOGY IDENTIFICATION WHICH MAY MIMIC PESTICIDE EXPOSURE SYMPTOMS, BEE KILL INCIDENT INVESTIGATIONS, FISH KILL INCIDENT INVESTIGATIONS, AND EMERGING MOSQUITO APPLICATION OFF-TARGET MOVEMENT INVESTIGATIONS.
OUTCOMES:
STATE AND TRIBAL ATTENDEES SHOULD COME AWAY FROM THIS PIRT COURSE WITH A THOROUGH UNDERSTANDING OF THE PRIMARY ELEMENTS AND TECHNIQUES ASSOCIATED DRIFT INCIDENTS, INVESTIGATIONS, AND ENFORCEMENT PROCEEDINGS. ATTENDEES WILL BE ABLE TO TAKE THIS KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE BACK TO THEIR RESPECTIVE AGENCIES AND SHARE WHAT THEY HAVE LEARNED WITH THEIR PEERS.
SUBRECIPIENT:
NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COLLECTING FISH TISSUE DATA FROM WATERS THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF INDIANA TO SUPPORT MULTIPLE WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES, PURCHASE MONITORING EQUIPMENT TO DEPLOY AT THREE REGIONAL MONITORING NETWORK SITES, AND FUND A CONTRACTOR WITH THE ABILITY TO COMBINE SEVERAL DIFFERENT DATA SETS FOR INDIANA LAKES INTO A SINGLE 'MASTER' SPREADSHEET FILE TO USE IN DEVELOPING AN ATTRIBUTE-RICH, HIGH-RESOLUTION INDIANA REACH INDEX (A GEOSPATIAL DATA LAYER AT 1:24,000 SCALE) FOR LAKES.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE OHIO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (OH EPA) TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PARTICIPATING IN NATIONAL COASTAL CONDITIONS ASSESSMENT ON LAKE ERIE AND DEVELOPING A PROBABILISTIC MONITORING PROGRAM FOR LARGE RIVERS.

ESTIMATION OF UNALTERED DAILY STREAMFLOW AND LOAD-DURATION CURVES AT UNGAGED STREAMS IN ILLINOIS AND INDIANA:  THIS PROJECT'S ACCOMPLISHMENTS ARE TO ADD CAPABILITIES TO A POPULAR WEB-BASED TOOL (STREAMSTATS) TO ALLOW COOPERATORS TO UTILIZE ITS MAPPING INTERFACE TO IDENTIFY UNGAGED SITES OF INTEREST IN ILLINOIS AND INDIANA, DELINEATE THEIR WATERSHEDS, MEASURE THE NEEDED BASIN CHARACTERISTICS USING STANDARDIZED GIS LAYERS, COMPUTE THE SIRED FLOW DURATION STATISTICS, AND ULTIMATELY ESTIMATE A DAILY STREAMFLOW RECORD, AS WELL AS DEVELOP A NEW STREAMSTATS TOOL TO ALLOW USERS TO COMPUTER THE LOAD DURATION STATISTICS.

THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE OHIO ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (OEPA) TO CONTINUE GENERAL MONITORING AND NATIONAL SURVEY ACTIVITIES. THE UPDATES WILL IMPROVE EFFICIENCIES IN DATA ANALYSIS AND EXTERNAL AND INTERNAL REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THIS WORK WILL MEET CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 305(B) REQUIREMENTS. THE OEPA WILL COLLECT AND ANALYZE FISH TISSUE SAMPLES FOR THE ANNUAL FISH CONSUMPTION ADVISORY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $164,620 TO FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION (FDEP). THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO AID THE STATE IN CARRYING OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATER BODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING THE DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE WATER QUALITY MONITORING AND SAMPLING AND REPLACEMENT/UPGRADE OF FIELD METERS AND PROBES.SUBRECIPIENT:FDEP ALSO PROPOSES TO CONTINUE WORK WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH FLORIDA TO MAINTAIN AND POPULATE THE CATALOG INFORMATION (LONG-TERM MAINTENANCE) TO MEET PUBLIC AND MULTIPLE AGENCY NEEDS.  THIS WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: MAINTAINING THE SITE, CONTINUED WEB HOSTING, AND WORKING WITH INDIVIDUAL DATA PROVIDERS TO POPULATE THE CATALOG. THE COST ESTIMATED FOR THIS MAINTENANCE IS $105,000 FOR 2022 - 2026.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE WATER QUALITY MONITORING AND SAMPLING AND REPLACEMENT/UPGRADE OF EXISTING FIELD METERS AND THEIR PROBES AS THE EQUIPMENT BECOMES ANTIQUATED AND NO LONGER SUPPORTED BY THE MANUFACTURER. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THE AGREEMENT ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF FLORIDA.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE CITIZENS IN THE STATE OF FLORIDA.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $164,620 TO GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES TO PROVIDE FUNDING TO THE STATE OF GEORGIA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO NEIWPCC TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES IN THE NORTHEAST. NEIWPCC'S ROLE IS TO INTEGRATE THE STATES' INDIVIDUAL EFFORTS TO COORDINATE, IMPROVE, AND MAINTAIN WATER QUALITY, AND THEREFORE MAKE SUBSTANTIAL CONTRIBUTIONS TO CONSTITUENT STATES IN IMPLEMENTING CLEAN WATER PROGRAMS. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING WATER POLLUTION CONTROL AND COORDINATION ACTIVITIES, TRAINING, AND REGIONAL INITIATIVES OF INTEREST TO CONSTITUENT NEIWPCC STATES.  ONE OF NEIWPCC'S MOST IMPORTANT ROLES IS TO IDENTIFY AND EXAMINE ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES COMMON TO ALL OR SOME OF THE STATES.  NEIWPCC WILL CONDUCT WATER POLLUTION CONTROL AND COORDINATION ACTIVITIES, TRAINING, AND REGIONAL INITIATIVES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE WORK PLAN AND THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT, SECTION 106 (CWA 106). INITIAL AWARD.ACTIVITIES:THESE CWA 106 FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT NEIWPCC IN HELPING STATES OF THE NORTHEAST TO PRESERVE AND ADVANCE WATER QUALITY. NEIWPCC WILL CONTINUE TO IDENTIFY AND EXAMINE ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES THROUGH THE FRAMEWORK OF STATE AND FEDERAL WORK GROUPS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT, CHANNEL INFORMATION, AND PRESENT RECOMMENDATIONS TO COMMISSIONERS REGARDING REGIONAL POLICIES. NEIWPCC WILL, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE STATES, TAKE A PROACTIVE LEADERSHIP ROLE ON REGIONAL AND NATIONAL ISSUES WHILE DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING WATER PROGRAMS COMPLEMENTARY TO AND SUPPORTIVE OF THE STATUTES, GOALS, AND PROGRAMS PURSUED BY ITS MEMBER STATES AND BY EPA AND OTHER RELEVANT FEDERAL AGENCIESSUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE EXPECTED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE CONTINUED EXCHANGE OF STATE AND FEDERAL PERSPECTIVES AND CONCERNS ON CLEAN WATER ACT PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES AT THE ENVIRONMENTAL AGENCY COMMISSIONER AND WATER PROGRAM DIRECTOR LEVEL; TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS ISSUES OF MUTUAL CONCERN TO WATER, AIR, AND SOLID-WASTE PROGRAMS; TO ADVISE THE STATES AND EPA OF PROGRESS TOWARD ACHIEVING OBJECTIVES OF NEIWPCC'S WORKPLANS AND OTHER ACTIVITIES; TO CONTINUE TO ASSIST THE STATES AND BE FLEXIBLE TO SUPPORT THE ATTAINMENT OF STATE CLEAN WATER PROGRAM GOALS AND ADDRESS SHARED CONCERNS; TO PRODUCE AND DISTRIBUTE CONTENT SHOWCASING RECENT NEWS AND WORK FROM NEIWPCC AND ITS PARTNERS; TO PROMOTE INTERSTATE COORDINATION AND COMPATIBILITY OF WASTEWATER-RELATED PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES; TO SUPPORT ENVIRONMENTAL TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE NORTHEAST; TO CONTINUE TO IDENTIFY AND EXPLORE HIGH PRIORITY WATER MANAGEMENT ISSUES, INCLUDING SOURCE WATER PROTECTION, INTEGRATION OF THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT AND CLEAN WATER ACT, NON-POINT SOURCE POLLUTION, EMERGING CONTAMINANTS, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF REGIONAL POLICIES OR POSITIONS WHEN NECESSARY; TO SUPPORT AN ENVIRONMENTAL ANALYST TO PROVIDE OVERALL COORDINATION OF THE ORGANIZATION'S WATER QUALITY MONITORING ACTIVITIES; AND LASTLY, TO SUPPORT THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (RIDEM) TO PLAN AND EXECUTE WATER QUALITY MONITORING, DATA MANAGEMENT, AND ANALYSIS FOR WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENTS UNDER THE CLEAN WATER ACT. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THAT OF THE SEVEN MEMBER STATES OF NEIWPCC, INCLUDING ALL SIX STATES IN EPA REGION 1.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF HAWAII TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS GROUNDWATER, RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING  CONTAMINATION AND DEGRADATION OF GROUNDWATER, UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES, AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. PROGRAM ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ADMINISTRATION, PLANNING, PUBLIC PARTICIPATION, MONITORING/ASSESSMENT, DATA MANAGEMENT, COORDINATION WITH PREVENTION AND PROTECTION AGENCIES, AND POTENTIAL GROUNDWATER CONTAMINATION EVENT RESPONSE.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $150,000.

THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF IOWA THROUGH THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (IDNR) TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES.ACTIVITIES:IDNR WILL PROVIDE DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS AT 42 SITES OF CHEMICAL GROUNDWATER SAMPLES AND PHYSICAL, CHEMICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES FROM STREAMS AND LAKES THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF IOWA AND WILL DISSEMINATE RESULTS TO OTHER RESOURCE AGENCIES AND THE PUBLIC.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE; ANNUAL AND FINAL REPORT OUTCOMES; CONDUCTING SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS AT IDENTIFIED SITES IN WORKPLAN (RIVERS, LAKES AND STREAMS) IN THE STATE OF IOWA. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: ENHANCED UNDERSTANDING OF SURFACE WATER QUALITY CONDITIONS IN IOWA AND STRESSOR-RESPONSE RELATIONSHIPS IN STREAMS. BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF COMPARABILITY OF STATE DATA TO REGIONAL AND NATIONAL DATASETS. IMPROVED METHODS AND METRICS FOR IOWA STREAM MONITORING AND ASSESSMENT. INCREASED EFFICIENCY AND SUSTAINABILITY OF THE IOWA STREAM PROBABILITY MONITORING PROGRAM. IMPROVED TARGETING OF WATER POLLUTION CONTROL EFFORTS BY IDNR AND COLLABORATING AGENCIES AND ORGANIZATIONS, AND IMPROVED HUMAN HEALTH. WIDESPREAD IMPROVEMENTS IN SURFACE WATER QUALITY CONDITIONS; OVERALL COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE CRITERIA AND ANTIDEGRADATION PROVISIONS CONTAINED IN IOWA SURFACE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS. PROTECTION OF PUBLIC HEALTH FROM THE RISK OF EXPOSURE TO REGULATED AND EMERGING CONTAMINANTS IN DRINKING AND SOURCE WATERS BY IMPROVING THE RELIABILITY, ACCESSIBILITY, AND RESILIENCE OF THE NATION'S WATER INFRASTRUCTURE TO REDUCE THE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE, STRUCTURAL DETERIORATION, AND CYBER THREATS. IDNR WILL ADDRESS SOURCES OF WATER POLLUTION AND ENSURE WATER QUALITY STANDARDS ARE PROTECTIVE OF THE HEALTH AND NEEDS OF ALL PEOPLE AND ECOSYSTEMS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF IOWA.

PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE IOWA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES TO ASSIST WITH THE MONITORING PUBLIC DRINKING WATER FACILITIES AND AMBIENT WATER QUALITY MONITORING.
ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THIS PROJECT INCLUDES EXPANDING SAMPLE ANALYTE SUITE WITH POLY FLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCE (PFAS) IN GROUND WATER AND SURFACE WATER SAMPLES IN THE FIRST TWO TIERS OF PUBLIC WATER SUPPLIES MENTIONED IN THE IDNR PFAS PLAN 2020.  THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE A MULTI-YEAR DEPLOYMENT OF A MONITORING NETWORK THAT WILL HIGHLIGHT NUTRIENT LOADING BY TRACKING NUTRIENT RESPONSE VARIABLES AND BIOLOGICAL CONDITIONS OF THE STREAM SYSTEM ON 4-5 STREAMS.
EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE OVERALL GOAL OF PREVENTING EXPOSURE OF IOWAN'S TO PFAS BY MONITORING PUBLIC DRINKING WATER FACILITIES.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO PROVIDE DATE RELATED TO THE QUANTITY LEVELS OF NUTRIENTS CURRENTLY MOVING THROUGH THE STREAM SYSTEM.    
INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INC
ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUND WATER POLLUTION FROM POINT AND NONPOINT SOURCES.
ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE MEASURES FOR PREVENTION AND CONTROL OF SURFACE AND GROUND WATER POLLUTION FROM POINT AND NONPOINT SOURCES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO FUND THE OKLAHOMA OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENT'S ONGOING WATER POLLUTION CONTROL PROGRAM. THE STATE WILL MONITOR SURFACE WATER QUALITY, DEVELOP WATER QUALITY STANDARDS, CONDUCT INSPECTIONS AND ENFORCEMENT, CONDUCT GROUND AND SURFACE WATER PERMITTING, DEVELOP TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOADS, AND DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED REPORT WITH A LIST OF IMPAIRED WATERS. THE STATE WILL SUBMIT WATER QUALITY DATA COLLECTED AS A DELIVERABLE, ALONG WITH AN INTEGRATED ASSESSMENT REPORT AND LIST OF IMPAIRED WATERS. OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE AN INCREASED UNDERSTANDING OF THE STATE'S SURFACE WATER QUALITY. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE OSEE AND THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. SUBRECIPIENTS INCLUDE THE OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND THE OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, FOOD, AND FORESTRY.

THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ISSUING AND ENFORCING NATIONAL POLLUTANT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION SYSTEM (NPDES) PERMITS, CONDUCTING AMBIENT MONITORING OF SURFACE WATER AND GROUNDWATER, AND DEVELOPING WATER QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLANS AND TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOADS (TMDLS).
