DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $164,620 TO THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION. THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE RECIPIENT TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: CONDUCTING FIELD SURVEYS AND FIELD OBSERVATIONS IN CONJUNCTION WITH MACROINVERTEBRATE, PERIPHYTON, AND CHEMICAL SAMPLE COLLECTIONS AT 11 SENTINEL REFERENCE STREAMS; MAINTAINING A FORMAL INTERAGENCY PARTNERSHIP TO DEVELOP A MONITORING PROGRAM; AND COMBINING DATA WITH OTHER SOUTHEAST STATES.
SUBRECIPIENT:TVA: SAMPLE ANALYSIS AND EXPERT VERIFICATION OF NEW TAXA FOR MACROINVERTEBRATE AND DIATOM SAMPLES COLLECTED IN 2023OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: ANALYZING MACROINVERTEBRATE AND DIATOM SAMPLES (INCLUDING DUPLICATE QC SAMPLES AT 2 SITES) THAT WILL BE COLLECTED IN 2023 AND 2024 AT 11 STATIONS SHARED BY THE STATE OF TENNESSEE AND TENNESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY (TVA), PLUS DIATOM SAMPLES AT 3 ADDITIONAL SITES MONITORED BY TVA. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $177,544 TO THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION. THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE STATE OF TENNESSEE TO PARTICIPATE IN SUPPLEMENTAL MONITORING INITIATIVES OR LAKES CONDITION ASSESSMENT TO BUILD CAPACITY IN THEIR MONITORING PROGRAMS BY UNDERTAKING A NUMBER OF ACTIVITIES, WHICH MAY INCLUDE THE USE OF STATISTICAL SURVEYS, IMPROVING DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, ENHANCING BIOLOGICAL MONITORING EFFORTS, EXPANDING MONITORING NETWORKS, MONITORING NEW WATER TYPES, AND/OR OBTAINING MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND CONTRACTUAL SERVICES. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE CITIZENS IN THE STATE OF TENNESSEE. OUTCOMES, OUTPUTS AND DELIVERABLES INCLUDE MONITORING AND SAMPLING TRAINING, DEVELOPING A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN, COLLECTING MONITORING SAMPLES, ANALYZING DATA, AND/OR UPLOADING INTO THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S WATER QUALITY EXCHANGE SYSTEM.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $ 223,505 TO TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT & CONSERVATION TO ALLOW THE STATE OF TENNESSEE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE SUPPLEMENTAL MONITORING AND NATIONAL AQUATIC RESOURCE SURVEYS FOR WETLANDS CONDITIONAL ASSESSMENT TO BUILD CAPACITY IN THEIR WATER MONITORING PROGRAMS BY UNDERTAKING A NUMBER OF ACTIVITIES, WHICH MAY INCLUDE THE USE OF STATISTICAL SURVEYS, IMPROVING DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, ENHANCING BIOLOGICAL MONITORING EFFORTS, EXPANDING MONITORING NETWORKS, MONITORING NEW WATER TYPES, AND/OR OBTAINING MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND CONTRACTURAL SERVICES.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $151,265 TO SUPPORT THE TENNESSEE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT AND CONSERVATION. THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW THE STATE OF TENNESSEE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE SUPPLEMENTAL MONITORING TO BUILD CAPACITY IN THEIR WATER MONITORING PROGRAMS BY UNDERTAKING A NUMBER OF ACTIVITIES, WHICH MAY INCLUDE THE USE OF STATISTICAL SURVEYS, IMPROVING DATA MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS, ENHANCING BIOLOGICAL MONITORING EFFORTS, EXPANDING MONITORING NETWORKS, MONITORING NEW WATER TYPES, AND/OR OBTAINING MONITORING EQUIPMENT AND CONTRACTUAL SERVICES. THE STATE OF TN HAS BEEN ALLOCATED 12 SITES FOR SAMPLING UNDER THIS PROGRAM.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $156,180 TO THE STATE OF TENNESSEE'S ONGOING PROGRAM TO CONTINUE SUPPORTING MODIFICATIONS OF THE ORACLE DATABASE TO MEET THE STATE'S PROGRAM NEEDS IN SUPPORT OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT, AND COMPLETE UPLOAD OF MACROINVERTEBRATE, PERIPHYTON, HABITAT AND PHYSICAL DATA TO STORET/WQX. MONEY WILL ALSO BE USED TO PURCHASE ELECTRONIC TABLETS TO FACILITATE ELECTRONIC DATA TRANSFER OF FIELD DATA AND SAMPLE SUBMITTAL.

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE SUSQUEHANNA RIVER BASIN COMMISSION (SRBC) TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE WATERSHED ASSESSMENTS, SUBBASIN SURVEYS, LARGE RIVER SURVEYS, AMERICAN EEL RESTORATION STUDIES, DAM REMOVAL STUDIES AND SURVEYS,  SOURCE WATER PROTECTION AND LEGACY MINING WATER QUALITY STUDIES. SUBRECIPIENT:A SUBAWARD FOR LAB ANALYSIS ($27,005) IS INCLUDED TO COVER THE COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH WATER QUALITY AND CHLOROPHYLL SAMPLES.  APPROXIMATELY 94 WATER QUALITY SAMPLES AND 72 CHLOROPHYLL SAMPLES WILL BE PROCESSED.  
OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND OUTCOMES INCLUDE A TECHNICAL REPORT ON THE UPPER SUSQUEHANNA SUBBASIN; A REPORT ON THE LOWER SUSQUEHANNA RIVER; A REPORT ON DAM REMOVAL IN CHIQUES CREEK; ASSESSMENT REPORTS; AND, ENHANCED COORDINATION AMONG PARTNERS INCLUDING SOURCE WATER COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND INCREASED COLLABORATION AMONG STAKEHOLDERS IN THE WATERSHED.  DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE SUSQUEHANNA RIVER BASIN.

FEDERAL FUNDS OF $491,000 ARE CONTINGENT UPON AVAILABILITY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO WEST VIRGINIA TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO NEIWPCC TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES IN THE NORTHEAST. NEIWPCC'S ROLE IS TO INTEGRATE THE STATES' INDIVIDUAL EFFORTS TO COORDINATE, IMPROVE, AND MAINTAIN WATER QUALITY, AND THEREFORE MAKE SUBSTANTIAL CONTRIBUTIONS TO CONSTITUENT STATES IN IMPLEMENTING CLEAN WATER PROGRAMS. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES, AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING WATER POLLUTION CONTROL AND COORDINATION ACTIVITIES, TRAINING, AND REGIONAL INITIATIVES OF INTEREST TO CONSTITUENT NEIWPCC STATES.  ONE OF NEIWPCC'S MOST IMPORTANT ROLES IS TO IDENTIFY AND EXAMINE ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES COMMON TO ALL OR SOME OF THE STATES.  NEIWPCC WILL CONDUCT WATER POLLUTION CONTROL AND COORDINATION ACTIVITIES, TRAINING, AND REGIONAL INITIATIVES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE WORK PLAN AND

THE NEW ENGLAND INTERSTATE WATER POLLUTION CONTROL COMMISSION (NEIWPCC) WILL CONDUCT WATER POLLUTION COORDINATION AMONG THE NEW ENGLAND STATES THROUGH MEETINGS, TRAINING, AND REGIONAL INITIATIVES. THE ROLE OF NEIWPCC IS TO INTEGRATE AND COORDINATE THE WORK OF EACH OF THE STATES TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN THE CONSTITUENT STATES.

THE NEW ENGLAND INTERSTATE WATER POLLUTION CONTROL COMMISSION (NEIWPCC) WILL CONTINUE TO CONDUCT WATER POLLUTION CONTROL AND COORDINATION ACTIVITIES, TRAINING, AND REGIONAL INITIATIVES OF INTEREST TO CONSTITUENT NEIWPCC STATES.  NEIWPCC'S ROLE IS TO INTEGRATE THE STATES' INDIVIDUAL EFFORTS TO COORDINATE, IMPROVE, AND MAINTAIN WATER QUALITY IN THE NORTHEAST.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO SHOSHONE BANNOCK TRIBE TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES ON TRIBAL LANDS. ACTIVITIES:THE TRIBES WILL SUPPORT THEIR VARIOUS WATER PROGRAMS INCLUDING WATER QUALITY STANDARDS AND CWA 401 PROGRAMS AS WELL AS THEIR WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM AND PERMIT REVIEW.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE WATER QUALITY DATA AND AN ASSESSMENT REPORT SUMMARIZING THE WATER QUALITY DATA COLLECTED AS WELL AS SEMI ANNUAL REPORTS DESCRIBING THE WORK PERFORMED UNDER THEIR WATER PROGRAMS.  THE EXPECTED LONG TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE MANAGEMENT OF THE TRIBES' WATERS AND IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF THE CONDITIONS OF THE TRIBES' WATER QUALITY.  THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE SHOSHONE BANNOCK TRIBES.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF WASHINGTON TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. THE WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (DOH) WILL CONTINUE ITS SOURCE WATER PROTECTION PROGRAM (SWPP) TO PREVENT, REDUCE, AND ELIMINATE POLLUTION AND TO ENCOURAGE PRACTICES THAT ENSURE A RELIABLE SUPPLY OF GROUNDWATER. DOH WILL WORK WITH PUBLIC WATER SYSTEM OPERATORS, COMMUNITIES, OTHER GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDERS, AND OTHERS TO REDUCE THE POTENTIAL THREAT OF CONTAMINATION AND SUPPLY DECLINE OF SOURCE WATERS SERVING DRINKING WATER SYSTEMS. DOH WILL USE THIS FUNDING FOR SEVERAL PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS BOTH WATER QUALITY AND QUANTITY CONCERNS, WORKING WITH REGIONAL PARTNERS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND ACTIVITIES

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE STATE OF WASHINGTON TO CARRY OUT ITS PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN, PROTECT, AND IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY OF ITS RIVERS, LAKES, STREAMS, GROUNDWATER, AND OTHER WATERBODIES. THE ENVIRONMENTAL BENEFITS OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE PREVENTING DEGRADATION OF UNIMPAIRED WATERBODIES AND REDUCING THE NUMBER OF IMPAIRED WATERBODIES IN THE STATE. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IMPROVING AVAILABLE INFORMATION ABOUT NITRATES AND PESTICIDES IN THE AQUIFER, BEST METHODS TO REDUCE THE RISKS OF THESE CONTAMINANTS, AND ILLUSTRATING PARTNERSHIPS THAT IMPROVE WATER QUALITY.

THIS PROJECT CONTINUES TO IMPROVE PROTECTION OF WATER QUALITY IN WELLHEAD AND SOURCE WATER AREAS FOR PUBLIC DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES. WASHINGTON STATE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH COLLECTS AND MANAGES SOURCE WATER ASSESSMENT DATA AND PROVIDES THIS DATA, TECHNICAL GUIDANCE, AND ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL JURISDICTIONS, WATER SYSTEM PURVEYORS, STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, AND THE PUBLIC FOR USE TO PROTECT DRINKING WATER SOURCES.  SOURCE WATER DATA IS USED BY OTHER ENTITIES FOR POLLUTION PREVENTION PLANNING AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE, ADOPTION OF BEST PRACTICIES, AND FOR LAND USE AND ZONING DECISIONS.
